title: Drawing, "View of Damascus, Syria, Part 1", May 2, 1868
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at lower left: View of Damascus / May 2d /68; again above: wely too large 2. Brown; again throughout: reddish / whitish/purplish & greenish/grey wely/meadow streaked/warm streaks/green .../greyer/rich/ golden/grey/rich sienna/grey cropping out/bank/water/nearer; and at lower right: a few o ....  [This inscription carries on into 1917-4-123-b: (o) lives / scattered here. LHC 11-7-2006]
description: Horizontal view containing a mountain slope at left, the tomb of a Muslim saint stands in the middle distance.  Foot hills and the plain are at right.  An irrigation pond is in the foreground.  The city of Damascus is seen in the distance in 1917-4-123-b, across the plain. Rocks are outlined in the foreground and like a ring over the sketched plain, at right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "View of Damascus, Syria, Part 1", May 2, 1868.
May 2, 1868. Graphite on off-white paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-123-a.
